I originally wrote this in a blog post.

The post was for the Harvard Business Review.

It was called “The Unimportance of Practically Everything.”

It was published on May 29, 2012.

Richard Koch wrote several books.

These include The 80/20 Principle and The Power Laws.

He also wrote The 80/20 Revolution and Living the 80/20 Way.

Warren Buffett is quoted in Koch's book, The 80/20 Individual.

Mary Buffett and David Clark wrote The Tao of Warren Buffett.

This book includes Warren Buffett’s words of wisdom.

I refer to “The Unimportance of Practically Everything.”

I met with Warren Buffett at the Gates Foundation.

He spoke and we chatted afterward.

He confirmed his belief in what he said.

John Maxwell wrote Developing the Leader Within You.

This book contains valuable leadership insights.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The concept of essentialism emphasizes the importance of focusing on what truly matters by recognizing the unimportance of practically everything else.
